p: The wild-growing fruiting bodies of Sparassis crispa (Wulf.: Fr.). were collected in the forests of Puszcza Solska (Lublin Voivodeship, Poland) in September 2018. Mushroom specimens were authenticated by Prof. Renata Nowak from the Chair and Department of Pharmaceutical Botany, Medical University of Lublin, Poland (voucher specimen No. MSH-076). After collection, the mushrooms were immediately lyophilized, pulverized and kept in a freezer (−30 °C) until further analysis.
